item.title: TDD with Go
item.description: I often find myself tinkering with Go as it possesses many of the language qualities I like - statically typed, compiled language that in many ways is similar to C, but with memory safety and garbage collection. Test-driven development (TDD) is a software development technique that relies on very short, repetitive development cycles. Business requirements are turned into very specific test cases, then the software is improved until tests are passing.
